speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Roz -- oh!  Baby pictures?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, these aren't the most flattering.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, nonsense.  Baby Alice couldn't possibly take a bad picture. [_takes them and looks_] Oh, well, that's just adorable, the silly little one with the jam all over her face.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, actually that's not jam, Frasier.  It's baby eczema.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Well, don't worry about that.  That sort of thing is bound to clear up. [_looks at next picture_] Or spread.

speaker: Roz
text: Just give them back!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, baby pictures!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I really don't want anyone to look at those!

speaker: Niles
text: [_looks anyway_] Well, I don't know why not.  Botticelli himself couldn't have painted a more perfect angel.

speaker: Roz
text: Thank you, Niles!  She is precious, isn't she?  _She gazes proudly at the photos.  Niles throws a disgusted leer at Frasier, who mouths, "I know."_

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, Niles, uh, how did things go with Maris's lawyers?

speaker: Niles
text: [_to waiter_] Cappuccino, please. [_sits down_] Maris is determined to prolong my suffering.  She's asked to postpone our court date another eight months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eight months?!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, last night I was in such a state I almost wished I had a piano to crawl under.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, it's a habit I developed as a child to combat anxiety. There's something about the safe, dark, protective environment that seemed comforting to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, the week before his first Little League trial, he practically lived under there.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, we all did weird stuff when we were kids.  _She throws a concerned look at Frasier, who mouths, "I know." The waiter brings Niles's coffee._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Niles, uh, how did your lawyers respond to this postponement request?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can tell you they weren't very happy about it! They got on the phone, raised some hell, and got that postponement cut down to... seven months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, are you serious?!  Do you think maybe it's time that you consider getting some new lawyers?

speaker: Niles
text: Fire Harrison & Reed?  They're the top firm in Seattle.

speaker: Frasier
text: But they're bleeding you dry!  Do you realize that they don't mind these postponements at all?  You know the longer they draw this thing out, the more money they'll get paid.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you know, I have the perfect person for you to call. My old boyfriend, Donny, he's a great lawyer!

speaker: Niles
text: [_snorts_] No offense, Roz, but I highly doubt that your "Donny" is in the same league with Harrison & Reed.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't be so sure.  I mean, he's smart, he's tough, he doesn't take "no" for an answer -- not that I ever tested that theory.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, wait a minute, wait a minute, are we talking about Donny Douglas?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, Niles, I've read about this guy!  He's the one they call "the Piranha," right?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, but that's partly because he has this night-grinding problem that makes his teeth really sharp and tiny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, anyway, Niles, I mean this guy just won a huge case. He might be just who you need.

speaker: Niles
text: I appreciate your concern, but really my situation is not as dire as you're making it out to be.

speaker: Roz
text: What's that smell?

speaker: Niles
text: What smell?

speaker: Roz
text: The one coming out of your briefcase.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't smell anything--

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, is this your lunch? [_pulls out_] A baloney sandwich? [_pulls out_] And a fruit cocktail?!  Oh, Niles.  You see what these lawyers have reduced you to?  Do you have any idea what they're having for lunch?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't know.  They don't itemize, they just bill me for the total.  _Roz and Frasier share a look.  FADE OUT_  **I GUESS YOU'D CALL THEM "LEGAL BRIEFS"**  _Scene Two -- Donny's Office Maria (Donny's secretary) shows Frasier and Niles in._

speaker: Maria
text: Donny should be here any minute.  Make yourselves comfortable.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you really don't have to stay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I didn't have to come at all.  But if I hadn't, you never would have.  Well, the office seems nice enough. Might have overdone it on the plants a little.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, it's excess like this that's destroying the plastic rainforest.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_warning_] Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, University of Las Vegas!  No problem finding tassels for those mortar boards.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you stop being such a snob?  Give this man a chance, for God's sake.  And please, will you have a mint?  I'm halfway across the room, all I can smell is baloney!  _Donny Douglas walks in.  He's a short, stout man who nevertheless has a sort of "lean and hungry" look about him.  His less-than- impressive stature is made less impressive still by the fact that he's dressed in sweaty gym clothes, having just returned from his workout._

speaker: Donny
text: Whoa!  Hey, how you doing?  Donny Douglas.  How are ya, who's who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Mr. Douglas, I'm Frasier Crane--

speaker: Donny
text: [_shaking hands_] You're Frasier Crane--

speaker: Frasier
text: This is Niles Crane.

speaker: Donny
text: [_shaking Niles's_] Oh, you're Niles Crane.  Frasier Crane? You're Roz's buddy, aren't you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, you got to do me a favor, O.K.?  Tell Roz, finally I had my teeth capped.  See?  _He spreads his lips with his fingers, showing his teeth in a way that gives credence to his nickname, "the Piranha."_

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, well, I'll tell her.

speaker: Donny
text: Promise you won't forget?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, not much danger of that.

speaker: Donny
text: OK.  Now I got to be in court in about, uh, twenty minutes, so sit down, let's get started.  _Frasier and Niles sit in armchairs in front of the desk.  Donny removes his sweatshirt, leaving only a tank-top, and throws it in a corner._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, as we discussed on the phone--

speaker: Donny
text: Maria, I need my gray suit for court! [_to Niles_] Come on, come on, come on!  _As Niles speaks, Donny further distracts him by wiping his chest and armpits with a towel._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Maris is determined to exhaust my already-strained financial resources, and the real injustice--

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, and Maria, could you just cancel that four o'clock of mine? [_takes off his socks and tosses them in the corner_] And can you also put Joe Silva on my call sheet? [_to Niles_] I'm listening, I'm listening, come on, come on, come on!

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, well, Maris has no right to be angry with me--

speaker: Donny
text: Maria!  You're the best, thank you so much, cool. [_to Niles_] What, what?  Come on, come on, let's go!  What?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh... I'm sorry, I forgot what I was saying.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, don't worry, Maria has that effect on men all the time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I think you were about to tell Mr. Douglas about Dr. Schenkman.

speaker: Niles
text: Right.  Well, uh, last year Maris and I were actually making progress in couples' therapy, when to my dismay I discovered that she and our therapist were--

speaker: Donny
text: [_mouth full_] Oh, my God.

speaker: Niles
text: That's right, they were--

speaker: Donny
text: This is the best corned beef I have ever tasted.  You've got to have a bite of this.  Here.  Come on, it's got spicy mustard!

speaker: Niles
text: No, thanks.

speaker: Donny
text: How about you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, mustard allergy.

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Douglas, maybe we'll come back when you have more time.

speaker: Donny
text: No, no, uh-uh!  I got the gist.  Your wife was doing your shrink, and now she's trying to bleed you with a long pre- trial.  I get it.  Who's her lawyer?

speaker: Niles
text: Lockhart & Whalen.

speaker: Donny
text: Maria, get me Lockhart!  Or Whalen.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, wait, wait, you're calling them?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah.  Listen, could we just cut through the formalities here?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, OK.

speaker: Donny
text: Niles, what you need is a guy like me representing you. What you're in here is a street fight, and you got to know who's covering your back.  So, what I guarantee you is this:  _He wraps a towel around his waist, and then pulls his boxers down. As he makes the following points, he gestures with the hand holding them.  They whip around, nearly hitting Frasier._

speaker: Donny
text: You will never see me unprepared, you will never see me intimidated, and you will never, ever see me throw in the towel!  You understand?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let's certainly hope not.

speaker: Maria
text: [_o.s._] I've got Geoff Whalen on Line One!

speaker: Donny
text: OK, thank you!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Frasier_] May I have a word with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Donny
text: Whalen!  Donny Douglas here, I'm calling about Niles Crane. Yeah...

speaker: Niles
text: I can't possibly let this man represent me.  I'll be humiliated!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you have got to hear this man out.  I'm sorry, this is exactly what you want in a lawyer, someone who's not afraid to show a little moxie!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, he's an inch away from showing us the Full Moxie!

speaker: Donny
text: ...facing a counter-suit for deliberate infliction of pain and emotional distress.  What, you don't think I can win? You call York & McFaddon.  You see what those bastards had to pay for trying to pull this same crap on a client of mine!

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, we're talking big numbers here, Whalen!  You haven't seen so many zeroes lined up since Mr. Spock had a book signing! [_covers the microphone_] You got to hear this, come here, come here!

speaker: Whalen
text: [_v.o._] Well, yes, of course it's important to be reasonable.

speaker: Whalen
text: Um, I'm sure we can move a few things around and be ready for court by... next month?

speaker: Whalen
text: Mr. Douglas?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah?

speaker: Whalen
text: Does this mean you're now representing Niles Crane?

speaker: Donny
text: That's exactly what that means.  And Whalen, I'll be in touch about a discovery schedule. [_sarcastic_] Have a nice day!

speaker: Niles
text: Mr. Douglas, that was brilliant.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  My goodness, almost makes me wish I was still married to Lilith!

speaker: Donny
text: Now they're probably going to get rolling sometime this week with depositions.  So, you know, pick a day, we'll get together, I will prepare you!  But it's going to be very low-key, very casual, you know, over dinner, something like that.

speaker: Maria
text: You're due in court in ten minutes.

speaker: Donny
text: O.K.

speaker: Maria
text: And Donny?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah?

speaker: Maria
text: [_points to her cheek_] Mustard.

speaker: Donny
text: [_laughs_] Oh, oh, jeez, was that there the whole time? [_Frasier and Niles shrug_] That's so embarrassing!  _He lifts a corner of the towel to wipe his cheek.  Niles and Frasier jerk their eyes away.  FADE TO:_  **INHERIT THE LONG-WINDED**  _Scene Three -- Apartment Frasier is seated at the coffee table, Martin is in his armchair, Niles stands near him.  Donny is also standing with some papers._

speaker: Frasier
text: And indeed, I had high hopes for Niles and Maris, as is witnessed by my wedding toast, in which I combined my heartfelt sentiments with apt quotations from Shakespeare, jazz great Louis Armstrong, and the poet Catullus.

speaker: Donny
text: [_sarcastic_] And so your answer would be, "Yes, I attended their wedding."  Once again, Frasier, could you try to keep your answers brief?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I--

speaker: Martin
text: Trust me, he did.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  Look, I'll try to do better.

speaker: Martin
text: I still don't understand why they're deposing Frasier before Niles.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, they like to question friends and family first so they can get as much "information" as they can to try and catch Niles out in a lie.  Now, look, they're also going to allege that during the separation, Niles was wasteful with money.

speaker: Niles
text: Wha...?  She's calling ME wasteful?!

speaker: Donny
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you recall what she used to do when one of our dogs needed a shampoo?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, she'd fill the bathtub with Evian!

speaker: Niles
text: Half the time she'd just get a new dog!

speaker: Donny
text: Anyway, look, Frasier, they might ask you if you witnessed any examples of Niles throwing money around, and your answer would be...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_pauses, then_] Yes.

speaker: Donny
text: [_exasperated_] No, no, no!  The answer is, "not to the best of my recollection!"

speaker: Frasier
text: But I do recall!  And I'll be under oath!

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, please, not this again.

speaker: Niles
text: As you've probably figured out, Frasier is a bit of a stickler when it comes to his ethics, and frankly I applaud him for it.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, great.

speaker: Daphne
text: More coffee, anyone?

speaker: Donny
text: No, thank you, Daphne.  I think I'm just about done here. In fact, I've got a conference call back at the office. I'm just going to check to see if that's still happening. Frasier, why don't you see if there's any more questions in there we haven't done yet, all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, uh... [_looks through list_] We've done those... Oh, here's one. [_reads_] "Can you recall a specific incident when Maris lost her temper or behaved in a way you'd characterize as volatile or unstable?" _The four of them think about it, apparently lost in thought. Then they all burst out laughing at the obvious answer._

speaker: Donny
text: [_into phone_] You're kidding!  No, really, well, based on what? Oh, please.

speaker: Niles
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Donny
text: No, it's OK. [_into phone_] Yeah, no, thank you, thank you, Maria, no. [_hangs up_] Maris's lawyers, they kill me. I mean, all week long it's been one desperate ploy after another.  This one, this is the best one yet! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what is it?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, now they're claiming "alienation of affection."

speaker: Martin
text: You're kidding me!  After what she did?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, believe it or not, now they're saying that during the marriage, Niles was in love with another woman.

speaker: Daphne
text: Who?

speaker: Donny
text: [_casual_] Oh, you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Me?!

speaker: Niles
text: [_half happy, half surprised_] Dear God!

speaker: Daphne
text: That's absurd! [_to Frasier_] Have you ever heard anything so ridiculous?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... not to the best of my recollection.  _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Apartment Resume:_

speaker: Daphne
text: Why on earth would they think Dr. Crane's in love with me?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, something about a country club ball the two of you attended a few years back.

speaker: Niles
text: This is all based on that?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah.  You caused quite a stir on the dance floor, or something?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, we were just putting on a show for his snobby friends.

speaker: Donny
text: You must have been very convincing, because they're going to subpoena you for deposition.  Now, look, you know, we can just call their bluff right away.  You can come tomorrow morning with Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: Fine by me.

speaker: Donny
text: OK, great.  Now listen, Daphne, I'm gonna have to prepare you for this, 'cause lawyers, they can twist your words around.  They get a judge to buy it, because of the pre-nup, Maris can really stick it to Niles.  But I've got this conference call at the office--

speaker: Daphne
text: I could come with you.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, great!  We'll get it done in about an hour.

speaker: Daphne
text: Just let me grab my coat.  Don't you worry, Dr. Crane!

speaker: Donny
text: Now, Frasier, I hope you realize they are going to ask you about this business too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?

speaker: Donny
text: Yes, but don't worry.  This is one time when your compulsive truth-telling won't get us into any trouble.  Bye.

speaker: Martin
text: Bye. _Daphne and Donny leave the apartment.  His parting shot has comforted the Crane boys about as much as we'd expect._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's it.  It's over.  It's over and I've lost.  Maris has won.  Maris always wins.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles--

speaker: Niles
text: Niles never wins!  Niles always loses!  That's why Niles lives at the "Shangri-La" and drives a hatchback!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, now get a grip!  Maris's people are just fishing. We're the only one's who know how you feel about Daphne.

speaker: Niles
text: Today!  Tomorrow, everyone will know, including Daphne.  And this is how she's going to find out.  I wanted to whisper it to her over a candlelight dinner, not have it read back to her by a court stenographer!

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?  Frasier's not going to tell!

speaker: Niles
text: He's gonna be under oath!  What if they ask him point blank?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, he'll just say no.  Right, Fras?

speaker: Martin
text: [_worried_] Fras?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not that simple!  You heard what he said, I'll be under oath.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God.  I can't breathe.  I can't breathe!  _He staggers, gaping like a landed fish.  Frasier grabs his neck and bows him over._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, here!  Put your head between your legs!  I'll get you some water!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, you'll be all right.  Just take a couple of deep breaths.

speaker: Niles
text: If I could take deep breaths it would mean I could breathe!

speaker: Martin
text: You're really not going to go down there tomorrow and blow it for him, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, there is nothing more I'd like to do than to help my brother.  But I would like to find a way to do it without violating my ethics!

speaker: Martin
text: But Maris is responsible for this divorce!  Niles's feelings for Daphne has nothing to do with it!  Now, if you cover for Niles you won't be doing anything wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we are talking about perjury!  When is that ever acceptable?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, you want an example?  Fine!  Let's say, uh, what if there was a comet hurtling towards the earth--

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake!

speaker: Martin
text: And you were the only person who could save the earth, but the only way to do it is by lying under oath.  Would you do it then?

speaker: Frasier
text: Who am I lying to, the comet?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, just answer the question!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I suppose in certain extreme cases--

speaker: Martin
text: So, then you'd lie?

speaker: Frasier
text: To save mankind from a talking comet, yes!

speaker: Martin
text: But you won't lie for Niles.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, you make me sound like some sort of insensitive lout who's not aware that his brother's out there in pain! [_takes a sip from the glass_]

speaker: Martin
text: Isn't that Niles's water?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just checking to see it's not too cold!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?  Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm over here.

speaker: Frasier
text: The piano, Niles!  Please, please, just come out from under there.  Things are not that bad.

speaker: Niles
text: Not that bad?  Daphne is going to find out about this!

speaker: Martin
text: Not if you crawl out before she gets home.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, please, come out here.  Now, come on.

speaker: Niles
text: Why should I?  There's nothing for me out there.  It's all lawyers and ex-wives and broken hearts.  All I have to contend with under here is a couple of dust bunnies... some cobwebs... some kind of a nest.  Dear God, doesn't your vacuum come with any attachments?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right.  Just sit tight and I'll get you a wet cloth. [_to Frasier_] Well, look what you've done, I hope you're happy now!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, do you really want to see me lying under oath?!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it's better than seeing your brother lying under a piano!  _Frasier follows Martin in to the kitchen.  Martin wets a cloth in the sink._

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I can't believe you're being so casual about this! Do you realize you're asking me to do something completely unethical?!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for God's sake, nobody's even going to know!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but that's the point!  Ethics are what we do when no one else is looking!  For heaven's sake, I learned that from you! Are you saying you wouldn't have any trouble with this?

speaker: Martin
text: Niles?  Here. [_throws him the cloth_]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Frasier_] Let me tell you something.  One time when I was on the force, I saw a guy shoot somebody.  When we caught him, I started to read him his rights, but he slipped out of his cuffs and he swung at me so I didn't get a chance to finish. Two months later, I'm on the stand, and his lawyer asks me if I'd read his rights in full.  Now, if I say no this guy walks, and this guy has been in and out of jail all his life, he could have read ME his rights!  So I say, "yes, I did.  I read them in full."  I lied under oath.  Now you might think that I did an unethical thing but there's not a doubt in my mind that I did the right thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after a pause_] Well, Dad, I'm still not sure what I'm going to do.

speaker: Martin
text: Why do you have to make everything so complicated?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know!  I just know that I'm never going to figure out anything with you barking in my ear! [_gets his coat_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, where are you going?

speaker: Frasier
text: To get some air!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, yeah, run away, just like you always do! [_to Niles_] Boy, I sometimes don't understand your brother.  I guess some of us can deal with a tough situation head on, and others just need an escape. _As he says this we see Niles cleaning his "escape-hole" underneath the piano, as Martin pours himself a stiff drink and takes a long sip._  **THEY'RE SOLID DISINFECTANTS, LADIES**  _Scene Five -- Donny's Office Frasier is sitting in an armchair.  Maria comes in._

speaker: Maria
text: Dr. Crane?  They'll be ready for you in just a few minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  Have you, uh--?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles -- no, not yet.  Daphne's still in the conference room. The place is slithering with Maris's lawyers.

speaker: Niles
text: Never a mongoose around when you need one. [_Frasier chuckles_] Listen, Frasier, I'm sorry I ever put you in this position.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, it's not your fault.

speaker: Niles
text: Now listen, I thought a lot about this last night, and I realize the way I was carrying on yesterday was just making it harder for you to do whatever you feel is the right thing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, honestly I'm still not really sure what the right thing is.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if it makes any difference, I've decided to tell Donny everything about Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, then he can proceed however he sees fit.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, why, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I started to wonder, maybe my feelings for Daphne did affect my marriage.  Maybe on some intuitive level Maris knew all along.  I can't be certain that that's not what drove her to Schenkman.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_firmly_] Listen to me: the only reason that marriage lasted as long as it did was because of the effort that YOU put into it.  From the moment that you slipped that ring onto her bony little finger and it slipped right off again! There is no way that this divorce is your fault.

speaker: Niles
text: I wish I could be sure of that.

speaker: Donny
text: OK, Frasier -- oh, Niles!  OK, good.  Frasier, they're just about ready for you.  Wait for me outside the conference room, will you?  And DON'T go in without me.  I want a word alone with your brother here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  Uh, I wish there was something I could do, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, there is.  When you go home this afternoon, leave a bottle of sherry under the piano.

speaker: Donny
text: WAIT for me. [_Frasier nods and leaves_] Right, Niles, I'm really glad you're here, there's something I really want to talk to you about.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I need to talk to you too--

speaker: Donny
text: No, me first.  Now, the only way this relationship is going to work, Niles, is if we're completely honest with each other.

speaker: Niles
text: I agree.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, I've been doing a little digging.  I've been finding out you've been holding out on me.

speaker: Niles
text: And I'm very sorry about that--

speaker: Donny
text: Well, why didn't you tell me that's where Maris's money came from?

speaker: Niles
text: It's never easy... Maris's money?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, I mean you told me that Maris's family money came from "timber?"

speaker: Niles
text: It did.  It did come from timber.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, that's what you really think.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, of course.  It's true.

speaker: Donny
text: And that's what all of Maris's friends think too?  All those country club snobs who would kill for a good piece of dirt on someone?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what are you talking about?  If her family money didn't come from timber, where did it come from? _Donny holds up the file he's holding with a flourish.  As Niles takes it and reads, Donny sits in his chair and puts his feet up.  Niles turns round with a surprised look on his face.  Donny returns this with a "Roger Moore" eyebrow._

speaker: Niles
text: Urinal cakes?

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe this!  All these years, the doyenne of Seattle's elite looking down her nose at everyone in sight, she owes it all to this.  She's managed to have her urinal cake and eat it too!

speaker: Donny
text: Yes, I think we now have what's known in the legal profession as a bargaining chip!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, are you kidding?  She'd give anything to keep this quiet!

speaker: Donny
text: [_gets up_] All right, let me go talk to Maris's lawyers.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no!  There's some news you'd like to deliver yourself. [_picks up the phone_] May I?

speaker: Donny
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Marta, I'd like to speak to Maris.  Oh, why not?  Ah. [_to Donny_] She's in the final level of her guru serenity training, the week-long vow of silence: day six! [_Donny rolls his eyes; into phone_] No, no, Marta, that's all right.  She doesn't have to come to the phone.  Just give her this message: I've _flushed out_ her family secret. [_Donny punches the air; Maris rushes to the phone_] Helloooooo, Maris!  _Niles puts his feet up on the desk.  FADE TO:  Scene Six -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Niles come in.  Niles is on top of the world._

speaker: Niles
text: I can't remember the last time I felt this way!  The air is sweeter and colors are brighter!  It's as if my very senses have come alive!

speaker: Frasier
text: It makes perfect sense, Niles.  You've just won your life back.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, wait, Frasier, watch this! [_stops a passing waiter_] Excuse me?  Today's special blend... [_sniffs the air_] Jamaican Blue Mountain.

speaker: Waiter
text: Yes, it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, that's very good, that's my favorite!  Well done.

speaker: Niles
text: Beans were gathered on the shady side of the northern slope...

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't push it.

speaker: Niles
text: I still can't believe this is all over.  And I never dreamed I'd get a settlement like that!  I'll be able to get my whole life back -- my apartment, my car!  And I owe it all to one amazing man.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Niles, but I can't take all the credit. [_laughs_] I know, you're thinking of Donny.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, don't think I'm not grateful for all you did.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, actually, to tell the truth, if it hadn't been for me badgering you to change your lawyers, Donny Douglas never would have come into your life.  _At this point Donny literally comes into Niles's life when he walks in on the arm of our Daphne.  They sit at the window booth.  Niles doesn't see._

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, we mustn't forget Roz's part in all of this.

speaker: Niles
text: Waiter! [_to Frasier_] Who understands why anything happens? I mean, it's remarkable how completely one's life can change in an instant--

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles...  _Niles solemnly gets up to greet them.  Frasier, unsure of what he's going to do, gets up and follows him._

speaker: Niles
text: Hi, you two.

speaker: Donny
text: [_noticing him_] Oh, hello!/Hi.

speaker: Daphne
text: Congratulations, Dr. Crane.  I'm so happy for you.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what are you two doing here together?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh well, you know, we talked--

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh well, after we worked on the deposition--

speaker: Donny
text: We got a little hungry--

speaker: Daphne
text: He took me out to dinner--

speaker: Donny
text: Too much wine--

speaker: Daphne
text: And we talked--

speaker: Donny
text: And we laughed a little--

speaker: Daphne
text: [_laughs_] Look at us, we sound like an old married couple!  _Niles's face shows that those last words have pierced his chest like a hot poker.  Daphne doesn't notice, then Donny drives it home._

speaker: Donny
text: I know.  You know, Frasier, if you hadn't brought Niles to the office, then, ah, none of this would have happened.  I guess I owe you one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we mustn't forget Roz's part in all this!

speaker: Donny
text: That scent is wonderful.  What is it?  _Daphne doesn't know, but Niles does.  He walks away with a sad look on his face which transforms the feeling of the episode totally to melancholy mode._

speaker: Niles
text: [_to himself; wonderfully acted by DHP, simple in a sad sort of way_] Cherry bark and almonds.  _Niles goes to his chair and sits down with a miserable look on his face.  Frasier consoles him and places a hand on his shoulder._

speaker: Credits
text: Frasier is seated at the dining table reading a book.  He gets up to pour himself a glass of sherry.  From under the piano a hand raises a second glass, and Frasier fills that as well.  Frasier picks up his book and goes to his room, saying good night to Niles, who is slumped under the piano, miserably sipping sherry.   * * *  ## Guest Appearances    **Special Guest Star** SAUL RUBINEK as Donny Douglass  **Guest Starring** ALOMA WRIGHT as Maria PAUL CUSIMANO as Waiter  * * *  ## Summary {kathy churay}     _Kathy Churay has written an episode summary which she has allowed me to use on this site. See the transcription for more infomation.  ACT ONE  SCENE 1 - Cafe Nervosa_  Roz is showing Frasier pictures as Niles enters to reports that Maris's lawyers are trying to prolong his torture by putting off the court date by another 8 months.  Frasier asks how Niles's lawyers responded, and Niles says they got it cut down to 7 months.  Frasier says it's time to consider a new lawyer, and Roz suggests her old boyfriend, Donny Douglas. Frasier is enthused -- "He's the one they call The Piranha, right?" Frasier's argument is proven when he discovers that Niles is now packing his own lunch, while the lawyers are putting their lunches on Niles's legal bill.   Frasier and Niles show up at Donny's office.  Niles is full of snobbery over the office decor, Donny's degree from a less than prestigious law school, etc.  Donny comes in wearing sweats, fresh from a workout.  He's in a rush and is due in court in 20 minutes. He encourages Niles to tell him the facts of the divorce, but as Niles attempts to do so, Donny begins to take off his clothes to change for court.  Niles tries to continue but is understandably distracted by Donny's eating his lunch, taking his clothes off, etc. Niles is ready to walk out when Donny decided to get on the phone with Niles' lawyers, and in short order browbeats them into setting a court date one month away.  Very impressed, Niles agrees that Donny should represent him.  As they depart Donny tells them he will contact them soon to prepare them for pre-trial depositions, just a casual dinner or something to discuss the questions that will be asked.   Donny, Frasier, Niles, Martin and Daphne are having coffee and discussing the testimony Frasier will give in his deposition the next morning. [Frasier has great difficulty being brief, as we all know.] Martin asks why Maris's lawyers want to depose Frasier before Niles, and Donny explains that they will want to find out as much dirt as possible from the friends and family before taking Niles' deposition, so they know what questions to ask Niles.  Donny continues to go over the questions Maris's lawyers will ask Frasier.  He asks whether Frasier ever noticed Niles throwing money around during the separation.  Frasier says yes, and Donny corrects him. "No, no!  Your answer will be, 'Not to the best of my recollection.'" Frasier protests that he can't give that answer because it's untruthful and a violation of his ethics, and Niles agrees with him.  Donny is exasperated and goes to the phone to check with his office for messages.  To his disgust he learns from his secretary that Maris's lawyers are making yet another desperate, outlandish accusation -- alienation of affection.  Maris is alleging that Niles was in love with Daphne during the marriage.  Niles is shocked  but looks almost happy to hear the secret out at last. Daphne is completely disgusted at the low-down lawyer tactics and asks Frasier, "Have you ever heard anything so ridiculous?" Frasier replies uncomfortably, "Not to the best of my recollection!"   _ACT TWO  SCENE 1 - Frasier's living room - continuation of previous scene_  Daphne asks why Maris's lawyers have such a ridiculous idea about her and Niles.  Donny replies that she and Niles had apparently caused quite a stir at a country club dance a few years back.  Daphne protests that it was all for the benefit of Niles' snobby friends, but Donny tells her the lawyers will subpoena Daphne to give a deposition about it anyway. Daphne replies bravely that she is ready, and in fact will give her deposition the next morning right after Frasier.  "Don't you worry, Dr. Crane!" she tells Niles stoutly.  She departs with Donny to his office, where he will prepare her for the questions she will be asked.  After their departure Niles is distraught because he believes he has just lost the divorce case.  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

speaker: Martin
text: "Niles, get a grip.  We're the only ones who know how you feel about Daphne."

speaker: Niles
text: "Today!  Tomorrow everyone will know, including Daphne.  And this is how she's going to find out.  I wanted to whisper it to her over a candlelight dinner, not have it read back to her by a court stenographer."

speaker: Martin
text: "What are you talking about?  Frasier's not going to tell."

speaker: Niles
text: "He's going to be under oath.  What if they ask him point blank?"

speaker: Martin
text: "Well, he'll just say no.  Right, Frasier?"  ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~  But Frasier can't give Martin the answer he wants, and the two get into a bitter argument over Frasier's ethics versus his loyalty to his brother. Martin argues the divorce was due to Maris's behavior, not Niles' feelings for Daphne which have nothing to do with the case.  But Frasier argues that, "Ethics are what we do when no one else is looking.  I learned that from you!"  Meanwhile, Niles regresses to his childhood and retreats under the piano to hide.   Frasier is waiting tensely to be called for his deposition when Niles unexpectedly shows up.  He tells Frasier he plans to admit everything to Donny, and in fact is having doubts that perhaps his feelings for Daphne did contribute to the breakup of the marriage.  Frasier sternly reminds Niles that he did everything he could to save the marriage and has nothing to reproach himself for.  Niles is grateful for the reassurance and as Donny comes in, Frasier departs to the conference room for his deposition.  Donny says he's glad to see Niles alone for a moment, because he has discovered Niles has been less than truthful with him.  Niles apologizes and is about to admit the truth about Daphne when Donny reveals that the new information he's discovered is not about Daphne. It seems that Maris's family money didn't come from the sale of timber, as she's told Niles and everyone else in Seattle society.  Baffled, Niles takes the file Donny hands him and reads with growing delight.  "Urinal cakes?" he marvels.  A smiling Donny replies, "I believe we now have what's known as a bargaining chip." Donny starts out of the office to reveal the new information to Maris's lawyers, but Niles stops him.   "There's some news you want to deliver yourself!"   Making himself comfortable in Donny's desk chair and propping his feet on the desk, Niles gloats as he dials Maris.   Niles and Frasier enter the cafe, Niles elated over the large settlement he's gotten from Maris.  "I'll be able to get my whole life back -- my apartment, my car....  And to think I owe it all to one amazing man."  Niles continues to rhapsodize about Donny as, behind his back, Donny and Daphne enter the cafe.  They sit down at a table very obviously affectionate with each other.   A downhearted Frasier points this out to Niles, who abruptly falls silent as they move to the window table to greet Daphne and Donny.  Daphne tells Niles, "Oh, Dr. Crane, I'm so happy for you."  Niles puts on a cheerful face as Donny and Daphne reveal that they're dating.  They seem genuinely happy with one another.  Donny is obviously infatuated as he leans and sniffs Daphne's hair. "Mmm, that scent is wonderful.  What is that?"  As Niles turns away he  answers quietly to Frasier, "Cherry bark and almonds."   The brothers return to their table and Niles sinks sadly into his chair with Frasier's hand on his shoulder.
